body: Is there a roadmap/IPEP for the contents web-service? I'm working to port bookstore notebook manager to IPython 2 and I feel like I'm late to the party.
I'm still working on the IPEP, I'll link to it when I put it up.
I've posted the current state [of the IPEP](https://github.com/ipython/ipython/wiki/IPEP-27%3A-Contents-Service)
Thanks @minrk
The `/files/` handler should be handled by the ContentsManager, but I don't want to deal with that in this PR.
Rebased, and review should be addressed. I don't have anything else planned to do here.

I do have other review that I am doing on this one - will try to get
comments to you soon, but not today - writing a letter for our BFDL...

## 

Brian E. Granger
Cal Poly State University, San Luis Obispo
@ellisonbg on Twitter and GitHub
bgranger@calpoly.edu and ellisonbg@gmail.com
Happy to hop in, I can ask @minrk to fill me in the details to save you time, @ellisonbg.
Sorry, misunderstood the ping... Yes, please stick to that letter ;)
Rebased on require.

General docstring comment. We have two different notions of paths:
1. Path in the REST API that are really just URLs.
2. Backend storage paths, like filesystem paths.

We refer to (1) differently in different places in the code. We should pick a consistent way of referring to these paths and use in all of the docstrings. Maybe "REST API path"?
Woo review! I'll get on it presently.

> We refer to (1) differently in different places in the code. We should pick a consistent way of referring to these paths and use in all of the docstrings. Maybe "REST API path"?

We use the API path in every single public API, so I think 'API path' is clear enough. The OS path is only used internally.
Clicking on a notebook in the dashboard no longer opens that notebook in a new tab - it navigates away from the dashboard in the current page.
The same is true of clicking on any file type in the dashboard - they should open a new tab.
Notebook uploading doesn't work. When fixing this, maybe look at how difficult it would be to enable uploading of other file types as well.
The Running tab is broken in the dashboard.
Ok I am done with a first pass. Let me know when all changes are made and I will make a final pass.
I'll need to look it over again to be sure, but I think I've addressed the feedback.
@ellisonbg should be ready to go now, I think.

OK I will have a look...

Brian E. Granger
Cal Poly State University, San Luis Obispo
@ellisonbg on Twitter and GitHub
bgranger@calpoly.edu and ellisonbg@gmail.com

Uploading a notebook to an empty directory does two wonky things (may be in master as well):
- The notebook list is not auto reloaded after the notebook is uploaded so the still shows the uploaded notebook at the top and the "Notebook list empty" is not cleared.
- If you manually refresh the list (but not the page) after upload, there are two versions of the notebook shown. Somehow the list clearing isn't removing the uploaded entry. A page reload corrects this.
Files and notebooks are now opened in a separate tab, but so are directories. I think that directory navigation in the dashboard should not open a new tab (keep same behavior as master).
This may or may not be related to this PR. I was using `FileLinks` to test in notebook linking to directories/files/etc and found it is broken with a `UnicodeDecodeError`. Hmmm...
I can't imagine how FileLinks would be related to this PR, since it's kernel-side code, and there are no kernel changes here. I believe I did fix the new-tab and upload behaviors you mentioned.

@ellisonbg can you create a reproducing example for FileLinks failing and open an issue? It seems to be working just fine here, with non-ascii paths and everything. I'm pretty sure that's unrelated to this PR.
I think this guy should be ready to go now, if anyone wants to have another look.
Thanks @Carreau, I'll try to address your comments this afternoon.
@Carreau's review (so far) should be addressed
